subject: Learning
title: Paulo Freire: Education as Liberation
description: Learn Paulo Freire: Education as Liberation in one minute.

hook.text: In 1960s Brazil, Paulo Freire taught illiterate farmers to read in 45 days. The government exiled him.

buildup.text: Freire rejected the 'banking model' where teachers deposit facts into passive students.

discovery.text: He proposed critical pedagogy: education should empower people to question and transform their world.

twist.text: His literacy method used words from students' livesâ€”'land,' 'vote,' 'hunger'â€”making learning immediately relevant.

climax.text: Pedagogy of the Oppressed became one of the most cited education books ever written.

punchline.text: Freire taught reading. His real lesson was freedom.

quiz.question: What did Freire call the traditional model of education?
options: The banking model, where teachers deposit facts into passive students
The progressive model of hands-on learning
